title: Problem with NY Times website
content:
Upon opening the NY Times website, page 1 flashes briefly. Then the screen locks in on a commercial which prevents further access to the paper. I cannot escape the ad.

This does not happen with Safari or Chrome.

Help!
creator: akopman

title: Syncing new device without losing existing bookmarks
content:
Hi, I have two laptops, and I've been using my Firefox account on one of them only. I want to link / sync the other laptop, and have the combined set of bookmarks from both laptops saved to my account. I want to make sure not to lose existing bookmarks from either one. That is, I don't want the sync to delete existing bookmarks on the laptop which is not yet connected. I want the two sets of bookmarks to be combined into one. How do I do that?

Many thanks, Noam
creator: noambergman

title: How to disable 'Set Image as Desktop Backgroundâ€¦'
content:
When I right-click an image, the context menu opens with an option to set the image as a desktop background. For almost all web images, this action makes no sense whatsoever, and for the others, I personally never want to use it.

How can I drop this action from the image context menu?

I have searched settings for context, background, and image, and I have searched about:config for desktop, background, context, etc.

Superuser has an answer making use of about:config `legacyUserProfileCustomizations`, which I would prefer to evade given its 'legacy' nature.

I expected an about:config flag but have not found one.
creator: kissaki

title: Firefox cannot find location, even with Location enabled
content:
I cannot for the life of me figure this out. Whenever I load a website that needs location (for example, Google Maps or my province's lottery) and enable location permissions, the websites come back saying they cannot find my location.

I have refreshed Firefox, disabled all Enhanced Tracking Protection, disabled all extensions, and have even ran Firefox in Troubleshoot mode - all to no avail. Is there any way this can be fixed? These websites all work on Chrome and Edge and work on my Firefox for iPhone.

On Windows 10 22H2.
creator: anthonydavidolynyk

title: LastPass
content:
I have been having a lot of trouble using the LastPass extension. I used to get a message saying "This is taking too long - Do you want to use Offline Data. Now I just get a message say an error occurred. I would then go to the LastPass web page to log in. I get the same message.

In desperation I downloaded Google Chrome and don't have a problem there, but I don't like using Google Chrome. I have been a long standing user of Firefox so do not want to change.

title: Startup Settings not working properly
content:
Firefox is opening on startup even though it is disabled in the settings.

I try to change the settings in Firefox and it prompts me to open my windows startup settings page.

The windows startup settings page does not have a Firefox on the list.

Both methods of disabling startup is inaccessible.

It looks like startup is disabled according to Firefox's settings, but it is not.

This is super annoying and a stupid problem.

creator: wzlbnu

title: Keyboard accessibility for new search bar?
content:
Upgraded to 139.0.1 and enabled new search bar, which wasn't appearing without toggling browser.urlbar.scotchBonnet.enableOverride to true. However, the bar seems critically hindered by lack of keyboard accessibility. Two things in particular:

1) when quick actions appear (e.g., Clear recent history), I cannot figure out how to navigate to it with the keyboard. Down-arrowing simply skips over it.

2) I don't seem to be able to select which search engine to use. On Mac, Option+up/down used to select search engines with the old address bar, but no key combination seems to move through or activate the drop-down menu of search engine choices.

The page introducing the feature doesn't seem to explain how to use it with keyboard at all. (https://blog.mozilla.org/en/firefox/address-bar/?utm_source=www.mozilla.org)
creator: jeremy
